title: 10 Undeniably Cool Winter Outfits, According to New York City’s Best-Dressed Ladies
description: I took notes from Suki Waterhouse, Bella Hadid, Katie Holmes, and more.
excerpt: Enjoy style lessons from Suki Waterhouse, Bella Hadid, Katie Holmes, and more.
text: For every souvenir shop in New York City, there are twice as many well-dressed women; they’re everywhere. I keep a running note on my phone to jot down pieces I spy on others to remember for future shopping trips. (Today, I wrote “green velvet pants”.... You had to be there.) It’s an amazing thing to witness, particularly at this time of year for someone like me that struggles to dress for cold weather. But in New York, there’s no shortage of winter outfit inspiration. And that brings me here. I keep tabs on what celebrities are wearing out and about for my monthly best-dressed column, so I couldn’t help but notice an influx of fabulous ensembles over the last few months. Ahead, see and shop 10 winter outfits that celebrities have recently worn in New York. Layer, Layer, LayerMichael SimonWhat’s more NYC than Timberlands? Nothing. If you missed your chance to snatch Emily Ratajkowski’s Mango sweater with a built-in scarf before it sold out in your size, fret not. This outfit formula is easy to make your own with pieces you probably already have in your closet—and her Gap jacket is still shoppable, too.Mango Striped Cardigan ScarfGap x Zac Posen Coated Denim JacketJaded London Oil Wash PantsTimberland Premium 6" Lace-Up BootsBottega Veneta SunglassesShashi Double Tsuki HoopsElevate Casual Staples With LeatherTheStewartofNYSeeing Nosferatu changed me as a human, and I’ve been watching Lily-Rose Depp’s laidback style with a keen eye since then. Her Y2k-esque Chanel bag will live on my wish list forevermore.Lioness Kenny Faux Leather Jacket We The Free Good Stripe TurtleneckRe/Done Originals ’90s High Rise LooseEterne Classic Ribbed SocksAeyde Oscar Leather LoaferFreja NYC Mini ChrystieDouble Down on DenimTheStewartofNYI haven’t stopped thinking about this 2002 Roberto Cavalli denim skirt set since Bella Hadid wore it in December 2024. Unfortunately, the exact ensemble is hard to come by, but you can take inspiration and double down on denim for an instantly chic outfit formula this winter. Plus, Hadid’s exact glasses are available to shop for just $27. Reformation Teresa Denim Jacket Reformation Kendi Denim Midi Dress Alexander McQueen Birdee Leather Knee-High BootsBrahmin Medium Asher True Vintage Riot Office Core GlassesSezane Iris RingInvest in a Faux Fur Jacket and TightsTheStewartofNYI, for one, am certainly not brave enough to wear denim cut-offs in the dead of winter, but damn, Suki Waterhouse does make me want to try it. This is a look fit for a rockstar straight out of Daisy Jones & The Six. Check. Sunglasses? Check. Black boots? I wouldn’t be caught dead without ’em. Olivia Munn’s timeless outfit is as replicable as they come. Don’t be afraid to play around by adding fun accessories. Women! Wearing! Ties! I love to see it. And the zip-up hoodie? Now that’s a fashion trend I can really get behind. I’m inspired by every one of Rosé’s ensembles. html:
For every souvenir shop in New York City, there are twice as many well-dressed women; they’re everywhere. I keep a running note on my phone to jot down pieces I spy on others to remember for future shopping trips. (Today, I wrote “green velvet pants”.... You had to be there.) It’s an amazing thing to witness, particularly at this time of year for someone like me that struggles to dress for cold weather. But in New York, there’s no shortage of winter outfit inspiration.

And that brings me here. I keep tabs on what celebrities are wearing out and about for my monthly best-dressed column, so I couldn’t help but notice an influx of fabulous ensembles over the last few months. Ahead, see and shop 10 winter outfits that celebrities have recently worn in New York.

Layer, Layer, Layer

What’s more NYC than Timberlands? Nothing. If you missed your chance to snatch Emily Ratajkowski’s Mango sweater with a built-in scarf before it sold out in your size, fret not. This outfit formula is easy to make your own with pieces you probably already have in your closet—and her Gap jacket is still shoppable, too.

Mango Striped Cardigan Scarf

Gap x Zac Posen Coated Denim Jacket

Jaded London Oil Wash Pants

Timberland Premium 6" Lace-Up Boots

Bottega Veneta Sunglasses

Shashi Double Tsuki Hoops

Elevate Casual Staples With Leather

Seeing Nosferatu changed me as a human, and I’ve been watching Lily-Rose Depp’s laidback style with a keen eye since then. Her Y2k-esque Chanel bag will live on my wish list forevermore.

Lioness Kenny Faux Leather Jacket

We The Free Good Stripe Turtleneck

Re/Done Originals ’90s High Rise Loose

Eterne Classic Ribbed Socks

Aeyde Oscar Leather Loafer

Freja NYC Mini Chrystie

Double Down on Denim

I haven’t stopped thinking about this 2002 Roberto Cavalli denim skirt set since Bella Hadid wore it in December 2024. Unfortunately, the exact ensemble is hard to come by, but you can take inspiration and double down on denim for an instantly chic outfit formula this winter. Plus, Hadid’s exact glasses are available to shop for just $27.

Reformation Teresa Denim Jacket

Reformation Kendi Denim Midi Dress

Alexander McQueen Birdee Leather Knee-High Boots

Brahmin Medium Asher

True Vintage Riot Office Core Glasses

Sezane Iris Ring

Invest in a Faux Fur Jacket and Tights

I, for one, am certainly not brave enough to wear denim cut-offs in the dead of winter, but damn, Suki Waterhouse does make me want to try it. This is a look fit for a rockstar straight out of Daisy Jones & The Six.

St. Agni ’90s Slim Oval-Frame Acetate Sunglasses

Entire Studios Mane Faux Fur Jacket

Mango Long-Sleeved Pointelle T-Shirt

Now 35% Off

Agolde Parker Long Shorts

Calzedonia Sheer Effect Thermal Tights

Zigi Amaranta Cowboy Boot

Tailor Your Look to Perfection

Brooke Shields was my first girl crush for her role in Disney Channel’s 2005 flick Bob the Butler, a movie that seemingly only my sister and I watched. All these years later, she’s still a vision in a fitted suit and metallic pumps.

Caddis Triple G Frames

Vince Double-Breasted Blazer

Norma Kamali Shirt with Collar Stand

Vince High-Rise Trouser

Tony Bianco Anja Heel

Mango Tie with Plain Design

Now 30% Off

Keep It Classy

Leather pants? Check. Sunglasses? Check. Black boots? I wouldn’t be caught dead without ’em. Olivia Munn’s timeless outfit is as replicable as they come. Don’t be afraid to play around by adding fun accessories.

Z Supply Mason Knit Coat

Simkhai Katy Turtleneck Sweater

Agolde ’90s Pinch Waist Long

Larroudé Anne Boot

Khaite Lina Crossbody Bag

Chimi 11 Tortoise Sunglasses

Play With Power Prints

This looks like a chic outfit one of my coworkers would stroll into the ELLE offices wearing—you know, the kind that makes you try a little harder the next day. Follow Kerry Washington’s lead and invest in a striped dress that adds dimension to your wardrobe.

Babton The Slouch™ Coat

Staud Claretta Striped Knit Maxi Dress

Aupen Nirvana Buckle

Inez Sylvia Boots

Gorjana Lou Statement Hoops

Ana Luisa Pave Rope Ring

Borrow From the Boys

More! Women! Wearing! Ties! I love to see it. And the zip-up hoodie? Now that’s a fashion trend I can really get behind. I’m inspired by every one of Rosé’s ensembles. This is just another flawless look to add to her ever-growing list.

Tiger of Sweden Lineman Tie

WAO The Zip Hoodie

AYR The Deep End Oxford

Loewe Wool and Cashmere Wide-Leg Pants

Tony Bianco Gatsby

Pandora Organically Shaped Stacking Rings

Put Comfort First

Katie Holmes is an underrated, low-key style icon. Doesn’t this just prove it? A big, shearling-trimmed coat like Holmes’ is a tentpole item for cold-weather dressing. While comfortable sneakers are a must-have for getting around New York City.

Stand Studio Patrice Faux Leather Coat

Now 63% Off

Everlane The Crew Cardigan

Reformation Val ’90s Mid Rise Straight Jeans

Madewell Wool-Blend Knit Beanie

Now 58% Off

Autry Medalist Sneakers

The Row Park Three Tote Bag

Extend the Life of Seasonal Pieces

Not every summer frock can be translated through the winter, but Olivia Palermo’s look is a masterclass in doing so. When layering a dress, opt for a turtleneck or tights underneath to stay warm.

Banana Republic Oversized Leather Bomber Jacket

Frame Rib Turtleneck Sweater

Confete Beatrice Toile Maxi Dress

Neil J. Rodgers Meg Knee Boot

Now 40% Off

Jenny Bird Aurora Studs

Jenny Bird Gia Bangle
